alert.note: Alert for Bergen (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 19 at 8:41AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...River and small stream flooding caused by recent excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Jersey, including the following county, Bergen. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM EST. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows remain elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 839 AM EST, Gauge reports from Hackensack River at New Milford indicated minor flooding. Flood waters should recede by this afternoon. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Losen Slofe, Hirshfeld Brook, Overpeck Creek, Hackensack River and Herring Brook. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
